description: white; one-piece unit; bulbous base with ear piece extending up from it; mouth piece in base; thin, black rubber band around bottom of base; rotary-dial on underside of base; red-circular hang-up switch in center of dial
text: Taking advantage of new, lighter materials and of miniaturized technology, Ericsson developed a compact plastic phone that included user-friendly components (earpiece, mouthpiece, dial and switch) in one unit, the first single-element (one-piece) telephone.  The design of the model combines a sensuality of form with advanced technology.  The earpiece and transmitter are contained in a unified plastic body, and the dial is installed in the base.  Described as "a technical sculpture," the phone was initially offered in 18 colors; the selection was later reduced to the eight examples on view in this installation.
title: "Ericofon" rotary-dial telephone
